English:

Title: Winnie the Pooh 
Original title: Winnie the Pooh 
Country: USA 
USA release: 15/07/2011 
Released in Spain: 20/04/2011 
DVD release (sale): 24/08/2011 
Studio: Walt Disney Pictures 
Director: Stephen J. Anderson, Don Hall 
Written by: AAA Milne (Work) 
Starring: [Voices] Jim Cummings, Craig Ferguson, Tom Kenny, Travis Oates, Bud Luckey 
Rating: Suitable for all audiences 


Synopsis: 
Walt Disney Animation Studios returns to the Hundred Acre Wood with "Winnie the Pooh." For more than 35 years that Disney did not lead to the big screen animated adventure Pooh. This movie is brand new but still has charm, wit and originality of the original shorts. The "Teddy Little Brain" reunites the public and his friends Tigger, Rabbit, Piglet, Kangu, Rito, and finally Igor, who has lost his tail. "Well, a queue is or is not," said Pooh. "And yours is not ... there." The Owl sends the whole gang to meet a strange mission: to save Christopher Robin a criminal imagination. So the day is much more complicated than just a bear had come to get some honey. "Winnie the Pooh" is inspired by the five stories of AA Milne. This classic Disney, whose drawings are made by hand, comes to theaters on July 15, 2011. 

Production notes: 
Inspired by the stories of AAA Milne's books in the classic Disney, hand-drawn. 

The screening of the film is preceded by the short film "The Ballad of Nessie," set in the Highlands of Scotland, is a fantastic story and very funny about Nessie, the friendly creature living in Loch Ness.
